dataset.title: Land Use Features
dataset.description:
Waukesha County Development plan as determined by the Parks and Land Use Planning and Zoning Division.  

Land Use Inventories are provided by the Southeast Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission on a five year basis corresponding to available orthophotography. 

Also included are amendments to the County Development Plan as well as inventories of specific land uses.

dataset.title: Environmental Corridors (2010)
dataset.description: This data set contains year 2010 environmental corridors and isolated natural resource areas for the seven-county Southeastern Wisconsin Region. Environmental corridors are areas in the landscape containing especially high value natural, scenic, historic, scientific, and recreational features. The polygon features in this inventory were delineated with reference to a number of Commission data sets, including 2010 Orthophotography, 2005 Environmental Corridor Inventory, 2010 Wisconsin Wetland Inventory, 2010 Land Use Inventory wetlands, and 2005 Natural Areas and Critical Species Habitat Inventories. The primary and secondary environmental corridor areas and isolated natural resource areas were digitized from these source materials by the Southeastern Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission GIS Division.

dataset.title: Proposed County Park Boundary
dataset.description:
The Waukesha County Park and Open Space Plan was adopted by the County Board on March 27, 2018 and is intended to act as a guide for the acquisition, preservation, development and management of park, recreation and open space lands in the County.

For the full plan text, see https://www.waukeshacounty.gov/globalassets/parks--land-use/park-system/park-and-open-space-plan/2018-final-pos-plan-update-final.pdf for more information.

dataset.title: Land Capability Class
dataset.description:
This data set is a digital soil survey and generally is the most detailed level of soil geographic data developed by the National Cooperative Soil Survey. The information was prepared by digitizing maps, by compiling information onto a planimetric correct base and digitizing, or by revising digitized maps using remotely sensed and other information.

This data set consists of georeferenced digital map data and computerized attribute data. The map data are in a soil survey area extent format and include a detailed, field verified inventory of soils and miscellaneous areas that normally occur in a repeatable pattern on the landscape and that can be cartographically shown at the scale mapped. A special soil features layer (point and line features) is optional. This layer displays the location of features too small to delineate at the mapping scale, but they are large enough and contrasting enough to significantly influence use and management. The soil map units are linked to attributes in the National Soil Information System relational database, which gives the proportionate extent of the component soils and their properties.

Soils

1. Description

Soil polygons identified by soil mapping unit ID.

2. Data Source

U.S. Department of Agriculture, Natural Resources Conservation Service

3. Date of Mapping

1971 (Rectified to Aerial Photography in Year 2000)

4. Mapping Scale

1:15,840 (1"=1,320')

5. Mapping Sources

Data captured from published Soil Survey of Milwaukee and Waukesha Counties, USDA Soil Conservation Service. Attribute data interpreted from NRCS soil attribute files.

6. Map Accuracy

Unknown

7. Map Currency

1971

8. Coverage

Waukesha County

Building Limitations

1. Description

A definition query was performed on each of the limitations using the soils database. In order to avoid duplication of features from three soil types (Pm, RkE & RlA), the erase function was used from ArcToolbox. By erasing the Depth to Bedrock from the the <1 Foot to Water Table, the result of that process erased from the <3 Feet to Water Table and finally that result erased from the Percent Slope, a heirarchy was established. In order of priority: <1 Foot to Water Table, <3 Feet to Water Table, Shallow Bedrock and Slopes >12%.

Depth to Seasonal High Water Table

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the DEPTH_TO_WATER_TABLE value field of the soils database. Depths were combined to create a specific range.

Hydric Classification

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_CODE value field of the soils database. Hydric and Hydric Inclusions were then color coded.

Hydrologic Soil Group (Native Condition)

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_SOIL_GROUP value field of the soils database. The different soil groups were then color coded. Dual Hydrologic Groups (A/D, B/D & C/D) represent drained and undrained conditions. D was designated for these groups to represent the native condition of the soil.

Hydrologic Soil Group (Native Condition)

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_SOIL_GROUP value field of the soils database. The different soil groups were then color coded. Dual Hydrologic Groups (A/D, B/D & C/D) represent drained and undrained conditions. D was designated for these groups to represent the native condition of the soil.

Percent Slope

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SLOPE_PERCENT value field of the soils database. Slope percentages were combined to create a range.

Stormwater Infiltration Potential

1. Description

Stormwater Infiltration Potential within Waukesha County.

Land Capability Class

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the LAND_CAPABILITY_CLASS value field of the soils database. Capability classes were then grouped and color coded.

Soils Parent Material

1. Description

This layer shows generalized soil composition groups based on parent material

Surface Textures

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SURFACE_TEXTURE value field of the soils database. Sandy Soils = Course Sand, Fine Sand, Fine Sandy Loam, Gravelly Sand and Loamy Sand. Loamy Soils = Loam and Sandy Loam. Silty Loam Soils = Silt Loam. Clayey Soils = Clay, Silty Clay and Silty Clay Loam. Muck Soils = Muck.

dataset.title: Historic Tax Parcel
dataset.description:
Simple view of Waukesha County tax parcels, simultaneous conveyances, civil divisions, rights of way, historic tax parcels (back to around mid-2000s), and annexations for display and download.

Parcel Currency:

dataset.license: For trails outside of County administration and maintenance, this data is a static snapshot in time (2018) compiled from multiple municipalities.  Do not use for navigational purposes.
dataset.title: Park and Open Space Plan
dataset.description:
The Waukesha County Park and Open Space Plan was adopted by the County Board on March 27, 2018 and is intended to act as a guide for the acquisition, preservation, development and management of park, recreation and open space lands in the County.

For the full plan text, see https://www.waukeshacounty.gov/globalassets/parks--land-use/park-system/park-and-open-space-plan/2018-final-pos-plan-update-final.pdf for more information.

dataset.title: Road Centerlines Local Government
dataset.description: Waukesha County E911 street centerlines reformatted in the Esri Local Government schema.  Information is gathered from municipalities and cadastral mapping activities as part of E911 support and then exported weekly to support Esri's Local Government applications, Community Maps, geolocators, and templates.  This data is always up-to-date within at most two weeks from being entered in the base cenerline data.

dataset.title: Airports
dataset.description: Airports in Waukesha County

dataset.title: Water Body Area
dataset.description: All planemetric water features from the Year 2000 orthophotography project.  Feature service contains two features, Water Body Area displays polygon features for all lakes and ponds, as well as rivers and streams wider than 5 feet.  Water Body Line displays all linear water features for rivers and streams less than 5 feet.  Also includes flow centerlines and segments that go underneath roads which are identified in the Type field.

dataset.title: Boundaries
dataset.description: Boundaries used for community data analysis such as Census Block Groups.  Note that the Zip Code boundary is maintained primarily for dispatch purposes and is not an official US Postal Service publication or from any other commercial source.

dataset.title: Hydric Soils
dataset.description:
This data set is a digital soil survey and generally is the most detailed level of soil geographic data developed by the National Cooperative Soil Survey. The information was prepared by digitizing maps, by compiling information onto a planimetric correct base and digitizing, or by revising digitized maps using remotely sensed and other information.

This data set consists of georeferenced digital map data and computerized attribute data. The map data are in a soil survey area extent format and include a detailed, field verified inventory of soils and miscellaneous areas that normally occur in a repeatable pattern on the landscape and that can be cartographically shown at the scale mapped. A special soil features layer (point and line features) is optional. This layer displays the location of features too small to delineate at the mapping scale, but they are large enough and contrasting enough to significantly influence use and management. The soil map units are linked to attributes in the National Soil Information System relational database, which gives the proportionate extent of the component soils and their properties.

Soils

1. Description

Soil polygons identified by soil mapping unit ID.

2. Data Source

U.S. Department of Agriculture, Natural Resources Conservation Service

3. Date of Mapping

1971 (Rectified to Aerial Photography in Year 2000)

4. Mapping Scale

1:15,840 (1"=1,320')

5. Mapping Sources

Data captured from published Soil Survey of Milwaukee and Waukesha Counties, USDA Soil Conservation Service. Attribute data interpreted from NRCS soil attribute files.

6. Map Accuracy

Unknown

7. Map Currency

1971

8. Coverage

Waukesha County

Building Limitations

1. Description

A definition query was performed on each of the limitations using the soils database. In order to avoid duplication of features from three soil types (Pm, RkE & RlA), the erase function was used from ArcToolbox. By erasing the Depth to Bedrock from the the <1 Foot to Water Table, the result of that process erased from the <3 Feet to Water Table and finally that result erased from the Percent Slope, a heirarchy was established. In order of priority: <1 Foot to Water Table, <3 Feet to Water Table, Shallow Bedrock and Slopes >12%.

Depth to Seasonal High Water Table

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the DEPTH_TO_WATER_TABLE value field of the soils database. Depths were combined to create a specific range.

Hydric Classification

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_CODE value field of the soils database. Hydric and Hydric Inclusions were then color coded.

Hydrologic Soil Group (Native Condition)

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_SOIL_GROUP value field of the soils database. The different soil groups were then color coded. Dual Hydrologic Groups (A/D, B/D & C/D) represent drained and undrained conditions. D was designated for these groups to represent the native condition of the soil.

Hydrologic Soil Group (Native Condition)

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the HYDRIC_SOIL_GROUP value field of the soils database. The different soil groups were then color coded. Dual Hydrologic Groups (A/D, B/D & C/D) represent drained and undrained conditions. D was designated for these groups to represent the native condition of the soil.

Percent Slope

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SLOPE_PERCENT value field of the soils database. Slope percentages were combined to create a range.

Stormwater Infiltration Potential

1. Description

Stormwater Infiltration Potential within Waukesha County.

Land Capability Class

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the LAND_CAPABILITY_CLASS value field of the soils database. Capability classes were then grouped and color coded.

Soils Parent Material

1. Description

This layer shows generalized soil composition groups based on parent material

Surface Textures

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SURFACE_TEXTURE value field of the soils database. Sandy Soils = Course Sand, Fine Sand, Fine Sandy Loam, Gravelly Sand and Loamy Sand. Loamy Soils = Loam and Sandy Loam. Silty Loam Soils = Silt Loam. Clayey Soils = Clay, Silty Clay and Silty Clay Loam. Muck Soils = Muck.

dataset.title: 2015 Contour Shapefile
dataset.description: Corresponding hydro-flattened Digital Terrain Model (DTM) files were created in Esri file geodatabase format. 1-foot contours were created from the hydro-flattened digital terrain model data and delivered in Esri file geodatabase format. The SEWRPC 2015 LiDAR project called for the Planning, Acquisition, processing and derivative products of LIDAR data to be collected at a nominal pulse spacing (NPS) of 0.7 meters. Project specifications are based on the U.S. Geological Survey National Geospatial Program Base LIDAR Specification, Version 1.2. The primary set of deliverable data was developed based on the following two horizontal projection/datum systems as specified in the contract: NAD83 (2011) State Plane Wisconson South Zone, US survey feet; NAVD88, US survey feet for Waukesha County LiDAR data was delivered in RAW flight line swath format, and processed to create Classified LAS 1.2 Files formatted to individual 10,000-foot x 10,000-foot tiles. Tile counts are listed below: Waukesha: 187 tiles

dataset.title: ORTHO1963 IS
dataset.description: This data set consists of digital aerial photo images obtained from 1"=1667' scale black and-white negatives aquired in the spring of 1963. The pixel resolution of the 400-scale imagery is one foot on the ground. The images are in a single county-wide file in MrSID compressed format with the accompanying sid "world" (sdw) files.

dataset.title: ORTHO1980 IS
dataset.description: This data set consists of digital aerial photo images obtained from 1"=1667' scale black and-white negatives aquired in the spring of 1980. The pixel resolution of the 400-scale imagery is one foot on the ground. The images are in a single county-wide file in MrSID compressed format with the accompanying sid "world" (sdw) files.

dataset.title: ORTHO1970 IS
dataset.description: This data set consists of digital aerial photo images obtained from 1"=1667' scale black and-white negatives aquired in the spring of 1970. The pixel resolution of the 400-scale imagery is one foot on the ground. The images are in a single county-wide file in MrSID compressed format with the accompanying sid "world" (sdw) files.

dataset.title: ORTHO2005 IS
dataset.description: This data set consists of digital orthophoto images acquired with a Digital Mapping Camera in the spring of 2005. The color images were taken from a nominal flight elevation of 5,000 feet, were compiled at one-inch-equals-100-feet scale, and have a pixel resolution of six inches (6"). The image files are available in GeoTIFF format and MrSID format.  Each GeoTIFF format file covers an area of 5,000 by 5,000 feet on the Wisconsin State Plane Coordinate System, South Zone, NAD 1927. The 735 GeoTIFF format files have zero overlap betweeen images and have accompanying "world" (".tfw") files.  The MrSID format files were prepared from mosaics of the GeoTIFF format files.  Each MrSID format file covers an area of approximately one-half of a U.S. Public Land Survey System survey township.  The 32 MrSID format files contain imagery beyond the boundaries of the survey township and do overlap.  The MrSID files have accompanying "world" (".sdw") files.

dataset.title: ORTHO2000 IS
dataset.description: This data set consists of digital orthophoto images obtained from 1:20,000 scale black-and-white aerial photography aquired in the spring of 2000.  The orthophoto files are prepared at two different scales: 1""=400' and 1""=200'.  Each 400-scale image nominally covers four U.S. Public Land Survey System sections, for a total of 148 digital image files in the 400-scale data set.  The pixel resolution of the 400-scale imagery is two feet on the ground, and the files contain overlap between images.  Each 200-scale image covers a USPLSS Survey Township, for a total of 16 images in the 200-scale data set. The pixel resolution of the 200-scale imagery is one foot on the ground, again with overlap between images.  The 1"=400 scale orthophoto files are in GeoTIFF format with accompanying ""world"" (tfw) files, and the 1"=200' scale orthophoto files are in MrSID compressed format with the accompanying sid "world" (sdw) files.

dataset.title: Elevation and Imagery Data Download By PLSS
dataset.description: This site allows for browsing, querying and downloading Waukesha County Topographic and Aerial photo GIS data.

dataset.title: Water - Planimetric Features
dataset.description: All planemetric water features from the Year 2000 orthophotography project.  Feature service contains two features, Water Body Area displays polygon features for all lakes and ponds, as well as rivers and streams wider than 5 feet.  Water Body Line displays all linear water features for rivers and streams less than 5 feet.  Also includes flow centerlines and segments that go underneath roads which are identified in the Type field.

Dual Hydrologic Groups (A/D, B/D & C/D) represent drained and undrained conditions. D was designated for these groups to represent the native condition of the soil.

Percent Slope

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SLOPE_PERCENT value field of the soils database. Slope percentages were combined to create a range.

Stormwater Infiltration Potential

1. Description

Stormwater Infiltration Potential within Waukesha County.

Land Capability Class

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed according to the LAND_CAPABILITY_CLASS value field of the soils database. Capability classes were then grouped and color coded.

Soils Parent Material

1. Description

This layer shows generalized soil composition groups based on parent material

Surface Textures

1. Description

Soil polygons displayed, by color, according to the SURFACE_TEXTURE value field of the soils database. Sandy Soils = Course Sand, Fine Sand, Fine Sandy Loam, Gravelly Sand and Loamy Sand. Loamy Soils = Loam and Sandy Loam. Silty Loam Soils = Silt Loam. Clayey Soils = Clay, Silty Clay and Silty Clay Loam. Muck Soils = Muck.
